## Autocompletion

KIMMDY comes with autocompletion for the `kimmdy.yml` file.
Run `kimmdy --show-schema-path` to get the path to the schema file.
Then, add the following to either the top of your `kimmmdy.yml` file or
add the schema to the global configuration of the `yaml-language-server` in your editor
(e.g. VS Code or Neovim).

```{.yaml filename='kimmdy.yml'}
# yaml-language-server: $schema=/your/path/to/kimmdy-yaml-schema.json
```

Once KIMMDY is public, you can replace the path with the following url:

```{.yaml filename='kimmdy.yml'}
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hits-mbm-dev/kimmdy/main/src/kimmdy/kimmdy-yaml-schema.json
```

## All Options

The following is a list of the options that can be set in the `kimmdy.yml` file.
It includes reactions currently available in KIMMDY as plugins.
Nested options are separated by a `.`.
`*` denotes an arbitrary name for a section.
The key for a section is **bold**.

| Option | Description | Type | Default |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| dryrun | Don't run the actual simulations, just print the tasks | bool | False |
| cwd | Working directory | Path |  |
| name | Used for output folder if `out` is not specified | str | kimmdy |
| out | Output folder | Path |  |
| log | Settings for logging |  |  |
| max_tasks | Maximum number of tasks to run. This is useful when a task in the sequence can dymanically add more tasks. 0 means no limit. | int | 0 |
| max_hours | Stop KIMMDY after max_hours hours. Set this lower than the limit of your HPC cluster for use with a re-submit jobscript. 0 Means no limit. | int | 0 |
| run | Replica number | int | 1 |
| top | Topology file | Path | topol.top |
| gro | Coordinate file | Path | conf.gro |
| ndx | Index file | Path | index.ndx |
| gromacs_alias | Gromacs alias | str | gmx |
| gmx_mdrun_flags | Flags passed to gmx mdrun. e.g. `-nt 8 -maxh 24` | str | -maxh 24 -dlb yes |
| ff | Force field directory (looks for .ff in cwd if not set) | Path | *.ff |
| plumed | .dat file containing plumed config | Path |  |
| tpr | .tpr file of a finished simulation for starting with reaction | Path |  |
| trr | .trr file of a finished simulation for starting with reaction | Path |  |
| mds | Settings for MD steps, e.g. mdp files, plumed files, etc. |  |  |
| mds.\*.mdp | MDP file for the MD step | Path |  |
| mds.\*.use_plumed | Whether plumed should be used for this run or not | bool | False |
| changer | Settings for applying a reaction recipe |  |  |
| changer.coordinates.md | Which MD instance from the 'mds' section is used for relaxation MDs | str |  |
| changer.coordinates.slow_growth | Whether the chosen MD instance is a slow growth/free-energy simulation | bool | False |
| changer.topology.parameterization | Parameterization scheme that is used on the topology file after changes to it | str | basic |
| sequence | List of tasks. Each task can be a string (the name of the task) or an object with the task name and a multiplicity `mult: <int>` | Sequence |  |
| reactions | Settings for reactions |  |  |
| reactions.homolysis.edis | Dissociation energies data file | Path | edissoc.dat |
| reactions.homolysis.itp | Additional itp file with bonded parameters | Path | ffbonded.itp |
| reactions.hat_naive.frequency_factor | Frequency factor | float | 1 |
| reactions.hat_naive.h_cutoff | Cutoff for H atom | float | 4 |
| reactions.hat_naive.polling_rate | Polling rate | float | 1 |
| reactions.dummyreaction.example | This is an example of an option for a reaction. | float | 0.0 |
| reactions.dummyreaction.example2 | This is another example of an option for a reaction. | str | hello |
| reactions.hat_reaction.frequency_factor | Frequency factor | float |  |
| reactions.hat_reaction.h_cutoff | Cutoff for H atom | float | 3 |
| reactions.hat_reaction.model | Model name, optional | str |  |
| reactions.hat_reaction.ensemble_size | Number of models to use, defaults to all, optional | int |  |
| reactions.hat_reaction.polling_rate | Polling rate, defaults to 10 | int | 10 |
| reactions.hat_reaction.radicals | Radical index, usually supplied through kimmdy, optional | int |  |
| reactions.hat_reaction.change_coords | How to change coordinates. H can be placed at the new position, or a (lambda)-dynamics simulation can be performed. For lambda-dynamics, set up the coordinate changer with slow_growth=True | str | place |
| plot_rates | Plot the reaction rates | bool | False |
| save_recipes | Save recipes as csv during `decide_reaction` | bool | False |
: KIMMDY options  {#tbl-options .striped .hover tbl-colwidths="[25,50,15,15]"}




## Example `kimmdy.yml` Files

```{.yaml filename='kimmdy.yml'}
dryrun: false
max_tasks: 100
name: 'hat_tf_000'
gromacs_alias: 'gmx'
top: 'Ala_out.top'
gro: 'npt.gro'
ndx: 'index.ndx'
mds:
  equilibrium:
    mdp: 'md.mdp'
  relax:
    mdp: 'md_slow.mdp'
changer:
  coordinates:
    md: 'relax'      
reactions:
  hat_reaction:
    frequency_factor: 100000000
    h_cutoff: 3
    polling_rate: 1

sequence:
- equilibrium
- mult: 2
  tasks:
  - equilibrium
  - reactions
```
